column4: Hello Ubuntu community :D, I am having a little noobish problem with updating and was wondering if someone would be able to answer a couple questions?
, try this command> apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade

k they both give the same package results and vary in size only by about 800kb.. one other problem is why is it trying to install an update for transmission when i uninstalled it and am using qBitTorrent?
is that the command that delete the program AND the config files? are am i getting them confused?
it will purge all transmission data
tried the command and it said Package transmission is not installed, so not removed
then it shouldnt recive any transmission data on upgrade
The following NEW packages will be installed:
did you see that or did the floodbot1 delete it? lol
yes the transmission-common package is still isntalled and marked as upgradable
i think synaptic froze maybe? lol.. its just hanging there saying Removing transmission-common and the file is only 56.7kb and im on a 1.5ghz dual core, 2 gb ram computer
nvm there it goes.. heres goes with the apt-get update
how do you know when to use dist-upgrade or just upgrade?
